definition: letter/symbol/character/word/CL:個|个[ge4]/courtesy or style name traditionally given to males aged 20 in dynastic China

sentences.english: Make a cut in the shape of a cross in the bag with a cutter flamed .
sentences.chinese: 用火焰切割器在包裝上切開一個十字形切口。

sentences.english: They brought them back home and tied them with a piece of string into the shape of a cross.
sentences.chinese: 他們把木棍帶回家，用一根繩子把它們綁成十字形。

sentences.english: It was only the cross piece that was carried by the prisoner.
sentences.chinese: 只是單單用來釘掛囚犯的十字形木片椴。

sentences.english: In most primitive religions, the cross represents the tree of life.
sentences.chinese: 在大部分原始宗教中，十字形代表生命之樹。

sentences.english: The passage (which was) placed with stone railings in cross shaped was called "chess-board street".
sentences.chinese: 石欄和過道交叉成十字形，過道叫做棋盤街。

sentences.english: Cruciate incisions heal poorly and are not required .
sentences.chinese: 不需要癒合差的十字形切口。

sentences.english: The iron supports of the well on the right form a cross.
sentences.chinese: 右邊護牆的鐵件作十字形。

sentences.english: The layout is Cross-shaped with relative positions of the five strokes.
sentences.chinese: 五種筆畫的相對位置是十字形的。

sentences.english: Buns marked with a cross were eaten by the Saxons to honour a goddess.
sentences.chinese: 撒克遜人把小麪包做成十字形的也是爲了向神致敬。

sentences.english: Just past the main entrance is a cross-shaped courtyard.
sentences.chinese: 過了主進口便是一個十字形的庭院。

definition: shape resembling the character 八 or 8/V-shape/splayed/figure of eight
